title: Algeria takes part in 8th Rome MED- Dialogues
text: Algeria is taking part in the 8th High-Level Forum for Dialogue in the Mediterranean (ROME-MED) with a large delegation made up of Minister of Foreign Affairs and National Community Abroad, Ramtane Lamamra, Minister of Energy and Mines, Mohamed Arkab, and Minister of Knowledge Economy, Start-ups and Micro-enterprises, Yacine El Mahdi Oualid, the event which will officially kick off this Friday, December 2, in the Italian capital, Rome.

Marked by growing global tensions and crises, this year’s session will be an opportunity to address a series of global issues, such as the future of multilateralism and world order, food and energy crises, as well as issues relating to sustainable development and environmental protection.

The Algerian delegation will highlight Algeria's contributions to the promotion of peace and prosperity in the region, as well as its vision of recent developments on the international scene and its recommendations for building a better world.

The 8th ROME-MED Forum will be also an occasion for both Algeria andy Italy to strengthen their bilateral relations which were marked by an exceptional dynamic following the visit made by President of the Republic, Abdelmadjid Tebboune, to Italy in May, in a addition to the holding of the 4th Joint Intergovernmental Summit in July, and very recently the meeting between the President of the Republic and Italy’s Prime Minister, Giorgia Meloni, on the sidelines of the COP27 Summit in Sharm El Sheikh, Egypt.
